title: Hunter Biden pleads not guilty to gun charge
description: The US president's son is accused of lying about his drug use when he bought a firearm in October 2018, during a period when he has acknowledged struggling with addiction to crack cocaine.

title: A European tax on the super-rich could bring in over €200 billion a year
description: A study commissioned by the Greens in the European Parliament assessed for the first time the potential revenue of a tax on the richest 0.5%.

title: Champions League: PSG bests Dortmund in opener
description: Kylian Mbappe and Achraf Hakimi each scored a goal at the Parc des Princes on Tuesday to defeat their German opponents 2-0.

title: France 'will not welcome migrants' from Lampedusa, says interior minister
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni had called on European countries to share the responsibility, after more than 8,500 migrants arrived on the Mediterranean island in the space of a few days.

title: Biden urges world leaders at UN to remain united against Russian aggression
description: The US president also told the UN General Assembly on Tuesday that the US sought to 'responsibly manage' its rivalry with China to avoid any possible war.

title: Zelensky tells UN Russia is weaponizing food, energy and children in its war against Ukraine
description: Addressing the 78th United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, the Ukraine president also described the abduction of children to Russia as a 'genocide.'

title: Kyiv is losing track of Ukrainian children deported to Russia
description: Following an arrest warrant by the International Criminal Court against President Vladimir Putin, Moscow is accelerating the issuance of Russian passports and attempting to prevent the repatriation of children to Ukraine.

title: The hunt for Paul McCartney's first bass
description: Like 'The Mona Lisa,' its value is priceless. The musician composed 'Love Me Do' and wrote 'Let It Be' using his first bass guitar and its loss left him inconsolable. Thousands of Internet users have set out to track it down.

title: Clamp down on Egypt's opposition ahead of presidential election
description: Hisham Kassem, a journalist and dissident who was expected to run against President Abdel Fattah Al-Sissi in the elections, was sentenced to six months in prison.

title: As the UN General Assembly opens in New York, everyone's trying to woo the Global South
description: The annual meeting of the United Nations opens on Tuesday with a speech by Volodymyr Zelensky. But this session will have to overcome the divisions between Western and emerging countries that have been deepened by the war in Ukraine.

title: Security Council leaders conspicuously absent from UN General Assembly
description: Only US President Joe Biden will be present at the major international forum, along with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: YouTube suspends Russell Brand's revenues from the streaming site after sex assault claims
description: The Google-owned company says the move is due to Brand's behavior 'violating our creator responsibility policy.'

title: Azerbaijan launches military operation in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: The Azerbaijan defense ministry said the operation began hours after four soldiers and two civilians died in landmine explosions in the Nagorno-Karabakh region.

title: Schools torched in Belgium: New sex education program targeted by waves of misinformation
description: The start of the Belgian school year has been marred by controversy surrounding a two-hour-a-year 'education in emotional and sexual relationships.' Ill-informed parents claim the goal is to hyper-sexualize children.

title: Ravages of storm Daniel pave the road to devastated Libyan city of Derna
description: The only route leading to the Libyan town, where thousands of people perished, bears the scars of the disaster. This dangerous road has already caused the death of several paramedics, but it is also the site of a long chain of solidarity.

title: Keir Starmer, leader of British Labour Party, outlines European policy
description: Rishi Sunak's rival has embarked on an international tour scheduled to bring him to the Elysée Palace on Tuesday.

title: Despite conflicting bilateral relations, US and Iran exchange prisoners
description: The agreement, which includes a financial component, opens a small window for the resumption of diplomatic negotiations on the Iranian nuclear issue, at a standstill since September 2022.

title: India expels senior Canadian diplomat in growing row over alleged Indian role in Sikh's killing
description: Hardeep Singh Nijjar, an advocate of Sikh independence from India, was gunned down on June 18 in British Columbia.

title: EU enlargement: France and Germany attempt to control discussion
description: A report commissioned by Paris and Berlin calls for substantial reforms to the union in order to welcome new entrants, at a time when Ukraine and Moldova are knocking on the door.

title: Migrants in Tunisia: 'It looks like they're pushing them to leave' for the Italian coast
description: At a time when thousands of people are disembarking in Lampedusa, Tunis is moving hundreds of sub-Saharans from the city of Sfax to the main departure points for Italy.

title: The unexpected impact of extreme weather events on forced marriages
description: A study shows a correlation between natural disasters exacerbated by global warming and the increase in early and forced marriages in certain regions of the world. This may be explained by the material hardship faced by populations.

title: The world's renewed interest in lunar exploration
description: India, China, Japan and Russia have all set their sights on the Earth's satellite, symbolizing a spirit of conquest. Reaching its orbit or surface is synonymous with modernity, advanced technology and even national prestige.

title: UK opposition leader Starmer to meet Macron at Elysée Palace
description: Struggling to make headway on his legislative priorities in a hung parliament, President Emmanuel Macron has a domestic political interest in showing he remains a coveted interlocutor abroad.

title: Operation The Force Awakens: The day elite Ukrainian soldiers planted a flag in Crimea
description: Military intelligence officers talk about the secret mission that led them to land on the peninsula annexed by Russia in 2014, on August 24, the anniversary of Ukrainian independence.

title: Reading in English is on trend for French teens
description: English-language departments in bookshops are experiencing an unexpected surge of young French customers, driven by the vogue for 'romantasy'.

title: EU 'Pact on Migration' still faces resistance, as Lampedusa crisis persists
description: In 2023, the majority of people attempting to reach Europe by sea have taken the central Mediterranean route. The European Union has been discussing the final agreement on the pact for migration and asylum for four years.

title: Life is starting over under the tents pitched in Morocco's earthquake-stricken regions
description: Ten days after the earthquake, emergency aid is still pouring into the villages of the High Atlas.
